titles.title: Employment Discrimination Evidentiary Amendment of 1993
To amend title VII of the Civil Rights Act of 1964 to specify certain evidentiary matters relating to establishing an unlawful employment practice based on disparate treatment.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Education and Labor.

action.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Select Education and Civil Rights.

bill.summary: 7/28/1993--Introduced. Employment Discrimination Evidentiary Amendment of 1993 - Amends the Civil Rights Act of 1964 to provide that an unlawful employment practice based on disparate treatment is established if: (1) the complaining party proves by a preponderance of the evidence a prima facie case that the respondent engaged in such practice; and (2) either the respondent cannot rebut such case, or the respondent produces evidence of one or more nondiscriminatory reasons for the conduct alleged to be unlawful and the complaining party demonstrates that each of such reasons is not true, but a pretext for discrimination that is the unlawful employment practice.
